result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas John Yurkew was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas John Yurkew is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas John Yurkew was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Continue on current payment plan.
DNA surcharge.
Defendant is eligible for expungement if he remains crime free for 12 months, but must petition the Court.

Review hearing at 10-10-2016 04:00 pm

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Jonathan Bradley Lundeen   DF:  Nicholas John Yurkew appeared. Includes 15CM393 and 15FO249. Case called at 4:20 pm. There is an agreement. ADA Correll recites. No objection from Atty Lundeen. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, Def pleads guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one. Court dismisses Count two and 15FO249. Court orders: 
- 1 day jail. Credit for time served
- Court Costs $443.00. Def to continue on current payment plan. 
Defedant eligible for expungement if he remains crime free for 12 months.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Status conference at 07-15-2015 03:15 pm

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rivers Edge Camp Ground.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Eric Gordon Johnson   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Nicholas John Yurkew appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Defendant may qualify for PD.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
